title: (x) "Taqueria Santa Fe" informal uneven sans caps - Lucheta Payol {Yves}
content:
Hey!

Trying to figure out what this is. It's killing me. Any suggestions?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [scan\_152.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072524/http:/typophile.com/files/scan_152.jpg) | 105.95 KB |
author: austin

comments.content:
Well, now I'm in the same boat. I have been looking for this every way I could think of to categorize it. The closest fonts i found were [Quixley](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072524/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/quixley/) and [Jackdaw](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072524/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fw-alias/jackdaw/), but neither of them is especially close. (In case you cared about 'Santa Fe' that is Ray Larabie's [Deftone](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072524/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/deftone/), with some grungifying).

Because this has the look of a freebie, I spent a lot of time first at Dafont looking for categories I thought would cover the style, but I couldn't find it. Partly, this is maddening because I think it looks familiar.

Maybe this post will prompt someone else to get aboard?

- Mike Yanega

thanks for the advice on santa fe.

in regards to the other part i think i'm just going to redraw the thing instead of dicking around waiting for an answer

Austin, I know you don't post here often, but it does help if you give a more descriptive title for your post. "Informal Uneven Sans Taqueria", for example, would have clued in folks who know more about that style of font, and Taqueria would be a key word I would remember if I found the answer, but wanted to find this thread again. You can edit the thread title, since you were the one who posted it.

- Mike Yanega
thanks for the info! i already redrew it.

There really was no need: this is Lucheta Payol by Mexican type designer Quique Ollervides as seen in [this FontFeed post](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072524/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/atypi09-preview-mexico-forging-the-character/).

[Here is a link](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315072524/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?psize=m&q=Luchita+Payol) to actually get the font (2 versions). That FontFeed was hard to connect to anywhere to get it.

- Mike Yanega
